subsection.name: Description
subsection.div:
Checks that there are no
"magic numbers" where a magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.
subsection.p: Constant definition is any variable/field that has 'final' modifier. It is fine to have one constant defining multiple numeric literals within one expression:

tr.td: Specify tokens that are allowed in the AST path from the number literal to the enclosing constant definition.

ARRAY_INIT , ASSIGN , BAND , BNOT , BOR , BSR , BXOR , COLON , DIV , ELIST , EQUAL , EXPR , GE , GT , LE , LITERAL_NEW , LT , METHOD_CALL , MINUS , MOD , NOT_EQUAL , PLUS , QUESTION , SL , SR , STAR , TYPECAST , UNARY_MINUS , UNARY_PLUS
Ignore magic numbers in annotation declarations.
Ignore magic numbers in annotation elements defaults.
Ignore magic numbers in field declarations.
Ignore magic numbers in hashCode methods.

subset of tokens
NUM_DOUBLE , NUM_FLOAT , NUM_INT , NUM_LONG .

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check with default configuration:
To configure the check so that it checks floating-point numbers that are not 0, 0.5, or 1:
subsection.source: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="MagicNumber"> <property name="tokens" value="NUM_DOUBLE, NUM_FLOAT"/> <property name="ignoreNumbers" value="0, 0.5, 1"/> <property name="ignoreFieldDeclaration" value="true"/> <property name="ignoreAnnotation" value="true"/> </module> </module> </module>
subsection.p: To configure the check so that it ignores magic numbers in field declarations:
To configure the check to check annotation element defaults:
subsection.source: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="MagicNumber"> <property name="constantWaiverParentToken" value="ASSIGN, ARRAY_INIT, EXPR, UNARY_PLUS, UNARY_MINUS, TYPECAST, ELIST, DIV, PLUS"/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.
